biogHist.abstract: The Christian Brothers Oceania Province was established in 2007 and brought together the previous provinces within Australia, New Zealand and Papua New Guinea, including the St Patrick's Province of the Christian Brothers. The new province was created to improve administration and enable the organisation to expand again. Its work focuses on adult education, social justice activities with refugees, asylum seekers, indigenous people and disadvantaged youth. The Christian Brothers Oceania Province formed Edmund Rice Education Australia to separate the governance and administration of the Christian Brothers' schools in Australia in 2007.

archref.repository: Christian Brothers Oceania Province and Edmund Rice Education Australia
archref.unittitle: Joint Statement from the Christian Brothers (Oceania Province) and Edmund Rice Education Australia (EREA) in relation to the Royal Commission into Institutional Responses to Child Sexual Abuse
archref.abstract: 'Joint Statement from the Christian Brothers (Oceania Province) and Edmund Rice Education Australia (EREA) in relation to the Royal Commission into Institutional Responses to Child Sexual Abuse' offers an apology and provides information about mandatory reporting, support and redress services for people who were abused in schools and institutions run by the Christian Brothers in Australia. The statement was issued prior to the first sitting of the Royal Commission into Institutional Responses to Child Sexual Abuse.
